'''New England Emmy Awards''' are a division of the [[National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences]]. The division was founded in 1977 and in addition to granting the New England [[Emmy Awards]], it recognizes awards scholarships, honors industry veterans at the Silver Circle Celebration, conducts National [[Student television station|Student Television]] Awards of Excellence, has a free research and a nationwide job bank. The chapter also participates in judging Emmy entries at the regional and national levels.<ref name="urlAwards honors">{{cite web |url=http://boston.emmyonline.org/about_us.html |title=Awards honors |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher=[[NATAS]] |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-10}}Academy History</ref>
==Boundaries==
The academy is divided into the following boundaries and encompasses [[Maine]], [[Massachusetts]], [[New Hampshire]], [[Rhode Island]], [[Vermont]] and the majority of [[Connecticut]] excluding Fairfield County. These boundaries are responsible for the submission of television broadcast materials presented for awards considerations.<ref name="urlAwards honors">{{cite web |url=http://boston.emmyonline.org/about_us.html |title=Awards honors |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |format= |work= |publisher=[[NATAS]] |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= |accessdate=2010-07-10}}Academy History</ref>

== Board of governors ==
Each year the membership of the [[National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences]] New England Chapter elects new professionals on rotating Board of Governors to represent the chapter.
